page.title: 02THROWLEY FORSTAL VILLAGE
page.content: Throwley Forstal is the only village in the area. There are two terraces of houses. Park Terrace has 8 houses and Jubilee Cottages 9 houses. There are about a dozen other houses grouped around the village green. Some of the houses are converted farm buildings. Pylons carry high voltage electricity over Park Terrace. There is a pub in the village called the Windmill because there used to be a windmill here. There is a small post office, but no shops. Although the road crosses the village green there is no bus service.There is a farm where people can buy logs and eggs, while many villagers grow their own vegetables. The school, which is in its final year, is about half a mile outside the village.
